title: HC quashes complaint against Kailash Kher for hurting religious feelings in song; says no malicious intent

content: Thousands of women devotees lit the small hearths they had set up on roadsides to cook rice mixed with jaggery as an offering for the temple deity.

content: Aleksej Besciokov is a Russian resident and Lithuanian national who was charged with money laundering and also faced accusations of violating sanctions and operating an unlicensed money-transmitting business

title: Pune bus rape: Court remands accused Dattatray Gade to judicial custody until March 26

content: The Delhi police instructed market associations and residents’ welfare associations to be vigilant about hiring or renting out spaces to foreign nations.

content: The CB-CID police, investigating the case, filed a chargesheet against police constable Muraliraja, Muthukrishnan, and Sudarshan, all residents of the same locality, for their alleged involvement.

content: Fishermen who helped the National Bureau of Fish Genetic Resources in identifying the species wanted it named after Tamil Nadu

title: RSS-BJP workers illegally detain Tushar Gandhi
content: The great-grandson of Mahatma Gandhi, Tushar Gandhi, detained by RSS activists in Kerala, sparking political protests and condemnation from various parties

content: A 38-year-old man from Thalassery undergoes palm amputation due to severe bacterial infection from fish bite in pit

title: Bhatti to present Budget on March 19
content: State Budget to be presented in Legislative Assembly on March 19, with sessions continuing till March 27 Business Advisory Committee finalises agenda

title: Telangana government forms Future City Development Authority; Hyderabad Metropolitan region expanded
content: FCDA will have in its jurisdiction over 765.28 square kilometres encompassing 56 revenue villages from seven mandals of  Ranga Reddy district, while  HMDA’s purview has been expanded to cover 10,472.723 square kilometres

title: Lok Sabha passes Oilfields Amendment Bill
content: The Bill seeks to amend the existing law governing exploration and production of oil and gas as well as delink petroleum operations from mining operations

content: Sanctioned in 2023, road project was delayed due to a lack of clearance from the Forest Department and enforcement of the model code of conduct for MLA and MLC polls

title: Immigration and Foreigners Bill not connected to grant of citizenship, says official
content: The Bill is a comprehensive legislation to regulate all matters relating to foreigners and immigration that are currently administered through four Acts, which are proposed to be repealed

title: Telangana government forms independent experts panel to study socio-economic survey data
content: Eleven member Working Group to analyse and interpret the SEEEPC data and submit its report within one month

title: In Rajya Sabha, Trinamool calls for short discussion on duplicate EPICs next week
content: Opposition paused its protest in the Upper House on the issue of duplication of elector photo identity cards (EPIC) and the delimitation exercise for a day

title: Rajasthan CM announces recruitment to 26,000 posts, poverty-free village, and employment schemes
content: Rajasthan CM Bhajan Lal Sharma targeted the Opposition Congress on several issues, saying its leaders lacked the vision for development and were embroiled in “internal conspiracy”

title: Railways to dig ponds under Mission Amrit Sarovar to fight water scarcity
content: Officials told to desilt existing water bodies or construct new ones at sites close to railway tracks

content: The movement of commercial vehicles on National Highways Number 2 and Number 37 was blocked by Kuki-Zo protesters for the fourth consecutive day

title: Cab driver helps nab men ‘disposing of’ body in Kolkata
content: The deceased owed a large amount of money to the accused, and was unable to pay it, the police investigation found

title: Thunder clinch playoff spot by passing Celtics test
content: The Thunder clinched a playoff berth Wednesday night in Boston against a defending-champion Celtics team that has achieved what Oklahoma City hopes to accomplish.

title: Rodgers a free agent for 1st time as Jets cut QB
content: The Jets officially released Aaron Rodgers on Wednesday, making him a free agent for the first time in his career.

title: Woman who accused Worthy gets protective order
content: Attorneys for Tia Jones confirmed she was granted a protective order against Chiefs receiver Xavier Worthy, adding that she is "fully cooperating with law enforcement as they continue to actively investigate the violence that occurred."

title: Plumlee, Adams ejected after first-half skirmish
content: The Suns' Mason Plumlee and Rockets center Steven Adams were involved in a first-half skirmish that resulted in both players being ejected.

title: Sources: QB Jones has 2-year deal with 49ers
content: Mac Jones, who wanted an opportunity to work with coach Kyle Shanahan, agreed to terms with the 49ers on a deal worth $7 million with $5 million guaranteed, sources said.

title: WR Williams returning to Chargers on 1-year deal
content: Mike Williams and the Chargers agreed to a one-year deal worth up to $6 million, a source told ESPN's Kris Rhim, confirming a Fox Sports report.

title: Montour nets NHL's fastest OT goal at 4 seconds
content: Brandon Mountour's goal just four seconds into overtime set an NHL record for fastest OT goal, lifting the Kraken past the Canadiens 5-4.

title: Simeone: 'Ball doesn't move' on disallowed pen
content: Diego Simeone questioned the decision to disallow Julián Álvarez's crucial penalty in Real Madrid's Champions League shootout win over Atlético Madrid, insisting "the ball doesn't move" after VAR decided the forward had kicked the ball twice.

title: Men's Bracketology: North Carolina climbs to 'last team in'
content: The Tar Heels improved their NCAA tournament hopes with Wednesday's second-round ACC tournament win over Notre Dame.

title: Women's Bracketology: SDSU seals spot, but all eyes on Ivy Madness
content: With the final two teams in the field facing off Friday, the center of the Bracketology universe is Providence, Rhode Island.

title: From a South Carolina repeat to UConn ending its title drought: Six teams that could win it all
content: Sixty-eight teams will compete in  March Madness. But these six make up the short list of title contenders.

title: NBA Power Rankings: Knicks slip while the Warriors climb
content: Our NBA insiders analyze this week's Power Rankings and assess the health status of all 30 teams with one month remaining in the regular season.

title: The inevitability of Real Madrid breaking Atléti hearts in the UCL
content: Real Madrid and Atlético couldn't be separated over two legs but, when Wednesday's match went to penalties, there was only ever going to be one outcome.

title: Quarterfinal predictions, from Real Madrid-Arsenal to Villa-PSG
content: The round of 16 is over and after some amazing Champions League action, what will happen in the next round?

title: 7 urns with human hair, skulls: 'Rs 1500cr fraud' at Lilavati Hosp with black magic twist
content: Mumbai's Lilavati Hospital trust accused former trustees of misappropriating over Rs 1,500 crore and performing black magic on hospital premises. A forensic audit revealed large-scale financial irregularities. Multiple FIRs have been lodged, and the Economic Offences Wing is investigating. The hospital trust is urging swift action to ensure responsible individuals are held accountable.

title: Stalin govt replaces rupee symbol with Tamil letter in budget amid language row
content: The Tamil Nadu government, led by MK Stalin, has replaced the Rupee symbol with the Tamil script 'ரூ' for the state's 2025-26 budget, sparking a renewed language debate with the Centre. BJP leaders criticized this decision, emphasizing the national significance of the Rupee symbol, initially designed by a Tamilian.

title: British woman raped at south Delhi hotel by man she met on Instagram
content: A British national was allegedly raped and molested at a hotel in South West Delhi's Mahipalpur, leading to the arrest of a man and a housekeeping staff member. The woman, who met the accused through social media and arrived in India earlier this month, reported the incident to the police.

title: Scientist killed in brutal assault over parking row in Punjab's Mohali
content: A dispute over parking in Mohali's Sector 66 led to the death of 39-year-old scientist Abhishek Swarnkar. His neighbour Monty assaulted him despite knowing his fragile health. The incident was captured on CCTV. Swarnkar was declared dead upon arrival at the hospital. Police have registered a case, and further legal action is pending.

title: WhatsApp may have just fixed the feature that made WhatsApp video calls dangerous and led to ‘nude scams’
content: WhatsApp is introducing a privacy feature allowing users to disable their cameras before accepting video calls. This new addition, found in the app's beta version for Android, will help protect users from privacy concerns and potential sextortion scams.

title: 2025 Tata Tiago NRG launched at Rs 7.2L: How's it different from regular model
content: The Tata Tiago NRG features new silver skid plates on both the front and rear bumpers, along with newly designed 15-inch wheel covers for the steel wheels. In addition to these updates, the NRG distinguishes itself from the standard Tiago with distinctive black side cladding, black roof rails, and an NRG emblem adorning the tailgate.

title: Are banks closed on March 13, 14 and 15? Check state-wise holiday list
content: Banks in various states will observe closures on March 13 and 14, 2025, due to Holi celebrations as per RBI guidelines. Physical branches will be closed, but digital banking services, including UPI payments and ATM operations, will remain available.

title: AB de Villiers on Rohit Sharma: 'Why would he retire?'
content: AB de Villiers praised Rohit Sharma for his leadership and batting after India's four-wicket victory over New Zealand in the ICC Champions Trophy final. Rohit top-scored with 76 runs and was named Player of the Final. De Villiers emphasised Rohit's impressive record and growth, dismissing retirement rumours and highlighting his significant contributions to Indian cricket.

title: Nithin Kamath says Zerodha user numbers down for first time in 15 years
content: Zerodha CEO Nithin Kamath revealed that the company is experiencing its first business slowdown in 15 years. A decline in active users across major stock broking platforms signifies a broader market correction. According to National Stock Exchange (NSE) data, eight of the top 10 broking firms saw a decline in active investors in February.  Kamath noted a 30% drop in trading activity due to market conditions and regulatory changes.

title: Ranya Rao gold smuggling case: ED raids multiple locations in Bengaluru, other places
content: The Enforcement Directorate conducted multiple raids in Karnataka in connection with a gold smuggling case involving actress Ranya Rao, who was arrested for attempting to smuggle gold from Dubai. Investigations point to a possible nexus with a smuggling syndicate, as additional officials and foreign nationals are also implicated.

title: No country has beaten poverty with freebies: Narayana Murthy at Mumbai event
content: N R Narayana Murthy, Infosys Co-Founder, stressed job creation by innovative entrepreneurs as the solution to poverty, not freebies. He urged entrepreneurs to build businesses generating employment, while expressing concerns over India's cash transfers to 80 crore people. Murthy also criticized many artificial intelligence solutions as outdated, emphasizing the need for genuine innovation.

title: Elon Musk seems to be almost 'choking' in interview talking about Tesla struggles
content: Elon Musk, CEO of Tesla, expressed emotional strain in a Fox Business interview due to challenges with his companies and Tesla’s stock experiencing a significant decline. Increased government involvement and attacks on Tesla facilities have raised investor concerns. Musk managing multiple ventures with difficulty, as seen in the video, suggests he is under immense pressure.

title: Puri restaurant sealed for ‘selling beef’, 300 tonsure heads in purification rituals
content: Over 300 residents of Puri district underwent purification rituals, including head tonsuring and religious ceremonies, after unknowingly consuming beef, mistaking it for mutton. The restaurant responsible was sealed following a video showing beef was being sold as mutton. Authorities are investigating the matter.

title: Madhya Pradesh horror: Dead baby in jaws of a stray dog
content: A street dog in Rewa, Madhya Pradesh, was seen roaming with a dead newborn in its jaws, attracting significant attention after a video circulated on social media. Authorities are investigating the incident, which marks the third instance of a dead newborn being abandoned in the district within the past three weeks.

title: The beauty of Phag! 6 traditional Holi songs all kids should know
content: Holi, the vibrant Indian festival, encourages kids to play outdoors, promoting physical and emotional well-being. It connects children to their cultural heritage through traditional stories and songs, fostering community spirit and inclusivity. Celebrated with family, it strengthens bonds and creates cherished memories. Traditional songs like 'Holi Hai' and 'Holi Khele Raghuveera' add to the festive joy.

title: Watch: Alia’s reaction as Ranbir smears cake on her face at pre-birthday celebrations
content: Alia Bhatt began her 32nd birthday celebrations with a cake-cutting event with the media and husband Ranbir Kapoor. Ranbir's playful smearing of cake on Alia's nose delighted fans. The couple will appear together in 'Love & War', with Alia embracing a no-makeup look. The upcoming film is set for release in 2026.

title: How Jacob deGrom is learning to throw smarter, not harder
content: DeGrom hasn't pitched a full season since 2019 -- but the Rangers ace has a plan to make 2025 special.

title: How the SEC became the most dominant conference in college basketball
content: Dwarfed by football no more, the SEC's rise as a men's basketball powerhouse didn't happen overnight.

title: Can anyone stop Scottie Scheffler? Who are some sleeper picks? Previewing the Players storylines
content: From Scheffler's attempt at a three-peat to Colin Morikawa's chances to get back in the winner's circle, we have five big topics to keep an eye on this week.

title: NHL playoff projections: Canucks or Flames for the final Western Conference wild card?
content: The two Pacific Division clubs vying for one spot face off Wednesday night in Alberta. Plus, updated playoff projections, draft lottery outlook, more.

title: Awards Watch: New leaders for Hart, Norris as playoff races heat up
content: With about a month left in the regular season, there are new leaders for league MVP and the best defenseman.

title: Maurice Cheeks reunites with Trail Blazers national anthem singer he aided
content: Prior to a 2003 Trail Blazers playoff game, 13-year-old Natalie Gilbert stumbled on her words while performing the national anthem before then-Portland head coach Maurice Cheeks stepped up to help.

title: Why astronaut Suni Williams runs in space: a 14-billion-year odyssey
content: Suni Williams' eight-day mission turned into a nine-month marathon. Now the astronaut is days away from leaving the International Space Station and returning to Earth.

title: UCL quarterfinals bracket set as Real face Arsenal
content: The Champions League quarterfinals bracket was set Wednesday, and it sends Real Madrid and Paris Saint-Germain toward more English teams standing in their path of the title.

title: 'We want more': Villa dreaming of toppling PSG
content: Aston Villa boss Unai Emery is thrilled to have steered his side into a Champions League quarterfinal, but now wants even more as they face a daunting clash with Paris Saint-Germain.

title: Bellingham: Madrid 'change mentality' in big games
content: Jude Bellingham said his Real Madrid team has the ability to change their mentality for big games, as they edged past city rivals Atlético Madrid on penalties to reach the Champions League quarterfinals on Wednesday.

title: Amorim: Players can't argue with Ratcliffe criticism
content: Ruben Amorim has told his Manchester United players that they cannot have any complaints about criticism from co-owner Sir Jim Ratcliffe.

title: Swanson to miss NWSL start for personal reasons
content: Chicago Stars FC forward Mallory Swanson will miss the start of the 2025 National Women's Soccer League season due to personal reasons, the club confirmed on Wednesday.

title: Messi set to return for Inter Miami in Jamaica
content: Inter Miami CF head coach Javier Mascherano confirmed Lionel Messi will be traveling with the team to Jamaica to face Cavalier FC in the second leg of the Concacaf Champions Cup round-of-16 series Thursday at Kingston's Independence Park.

title: Ronaldo withdraws from CBF presidential race
content: Brazil football great Ronaldo said that he was pulling out of the race to be president of his country's football association (CBF) on Wednesday after failing to gather enough support from regional federations to present a candidacy.

title: Quakes reign could define ex-USMNT boss Arena's complicated legacy
content: Bruce Arena is the greatest American soccer coach in history, but in a career of highs and lows, his Earthquakes job could cement how he's remembered.

title: MMA divisional rankings: How far does Alex Pereira fall at light heavyweight?
content: Here's a look at every weight class to determine the best of the best in UFC, Bellator, PFL and beyond.

title: People shocked at striking similarity between Rishabh Pant and his sister's husband
content: Cricketer Rishabh Pant recently attended the wedding of his sister Sakshi Pant to Ankit Choudary in Mussoorie. The event garnered attention not only for the presence of several famous cricketers but also due to the surprising resemblance between Rishabh and his new brother-in-law Ankit.

title: Why UP CM Yogi Adityanath became a ‘poster boy’ in Nepal rally
content: Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath's posters at a rally in Kathmandu supporting the former Nepal king sparked a stir, highlighting the historical ties between Gorakhsh Peeth and the Shah Dynasty. Yogi has previously advocated for Nepal's Hindu nation status. A follower, Pradeep Bikram Rana, fled to Gorakhpur, citing persecution in Kathmandu.

title: Kolkata horror: Late-night road rage ends in biker’s death, motorist held
content: In Salt Lake, a collision between a motorist and a biker escalated into a chase, resulting in the biker's death. The biker, Aiyaz Hussain, lost control and skidded on an uneven, poorly lit road. Local residents apprehended the motorist, Piyush Agarwal, who was later arrested for causing death due to negligence and sent to jail custody.

title: 'Could do things very bad for Russia': Trump warns Putin amid ceasefire talks
content: President Trump has warned Russia of severe financial repercussions if it does not agree to the proposed ceasefire in Ukraine. While US negotiators are en route to Russia, Ukrainian President Zelenskyy remains skeptical. Trump remains hopeful for a diplomatic resolution, while Vice President Vance and other key officials continue discussions with Russia to finalize the ceasefire plan.

title: Ranya Rao gold case: Why Karnataka home dept backtracked from CID probe
content: Ranya Rao, a Kannada film starlet, is under investigation for her alleged involvement in a Rs 12.56 crore gold smuggling case, using VIP services at the Bengaluru airport. Her stepfather, a senior police officer, is also being scrutinized for his role in the scandal.

title: Suchir Balaji's mother shares pic from day of his death, alleges 'murder'
content: Suchir Balaji's mother challenges the suicide ruling over her son’s death, citing inconsistencies and potential foul play. She questions the use of sedatives and faulty CCTV footage. Despite authorities maintaining the suicide verdict, the family persists in seeking justice with independent investigations, drawing support from figures like Elon Musk who also suspects foul play.

title: 'Damage to trees': WB govt imposes ban on Holi celebrations in Santiniketan
content: The West Bengal government has banned Holi celebrations at Sonajhuri Haat in Santiniketan due to concerns over potential damage to the area's greenery. Authorities have placed banners advising visitors not to park vehicles or celebrate Holi there, citing its proximity to Visva Bharati University, a UNESCO World Heritage site.

title: Pakistan train attack: Why is there an increase in attacks in Balochistan?
content: Balochistan's long-standing insurgency reached a new level, with the Baluch Liberation Army seizing a passenger train. The militants killed 21 passengers before being overpowered by Pakistani forces. The BLA fights for independence and more control over Balochistan's resources, claiming support from India. This attack might weaken their support despite drawing significant attention.

title: '99.9% of people are happy': Brij Bhushan on WFI ban lift
content: The Union Ministry of Youth Affairs and Sports restored the Wrestling Federation of India's recognition, lifting its suspension. Former WFI President, Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh shared his views on the decision. The suspension was initially imposed due to procedural lapses and accusations of sexual harassment against Singh, but has now been lifted to benefit the sport and its athletes.

title: 80 year old mother donates kidney to her son in a remarkable story of love
content: An 80-year-old woman donated her kidney to her 59-year-old son with end-stage renal disease. The transplant was successfully conducted by Dr. HS Bhatyal and his team at BLK-Max Super Speciality Hospital. Both the mother and son have recovered well and were discharged a few days after the surgery. This case emphasizes the potential of modern medicine.

title: Karnataka SSLC hall ticket 2025: Check key details to access the admit card
content: The Karnataka School Examination and Assessment Board (KSEAB) has released admit cards for the SSLC exams, which will be held from March 20 to April 2, 2025. Schools must verify student details by March 17. Hall tickets can be downloaded online or collected from schools. Principals will be accountable for errors, and special accommodations must be confirmed in advance.

title: UP man gives Rs 50,000 to ‘gau rakshak’ to frame rival in cow slaughter case
content: A 'gau rakshak' named Vish Singh Kamboj was arrested in Saharanpur for fabricating a cow slaughter case to frame a rival meat trader. His actions included placing old bovine remains on a highway to demand police action. Another trader, Tipu Qureshi, allegedly paid Kamboj to target his more successful business partner. Qureshi is currently at large.

title: Former Aus cricketer MacGill found guilty in cocaine deal
content: A Sydney District Court jury acquitted former Australia Test cricketer Stuart MacGill of involvement in a significant commercial drug deal but convicted him on a lesser charge tied to drug supply. Despite arranging a meeting, MacGill claimed he was unaware of the cocaine transaction arranged by his supplier and brother-in-law.

title: 'What's new?': Bhupinder Hooda plays down BJP’s victory in local elections
content: Former Haryana CM Bhupinder Singh Hooda downplayed BJP's victory in the municipal elections, noting that the party has won before. Haryana CM Nayab Singh Saini commended local body's role in achieving PM Modi's vision. BJP secured nine mayoral posts, except in Manesar. In Faridabad, Mayor-elect Parveen Joshi pledged to address local issues.

title: Holika Dahan 2025: Your guide to shubh muhurat, pooja vidhi and mantras
content: Holika Dahan, a significant Hindu festival, will be observed on March 13, 2025. The festival symbolizes the triumph of good over evil and includes specific rituals. The auspicious time for the rituals begins after Bhadra Kaal and continues into Pradosh Kaal. Essential materials and mantras are also suggested for a spiritually fulfilling celebration.

title: PFL FAQ: What big changes are coming this year?
content: Who's fighting in the PFL -- and who's not -- in 2025? Here's everything you need to know about the new format.

title: Kings of command: Breakout pitchers to draft
content: Which overlooked pitchers have the skill set to come up with a big season? Tristan H. Cockcroft digs deep into the numbers to present his annual look at MLB's "Kings of Command."

title: Man United's Europa League fate depends on a misfiring attack finding the net
content: Man United's season hinges on advancing in the Europa League, but thanks to their woefully underperforming attack, it's far from guaranteed.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Isak firms as Arsenal's No. 1 target
content: Goal-shy Arsenal reportedly have Newcastle's Alexander Isak at the top of their summer shortlist. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Australian GP: All you need to know ahead of the first race of 2025
content: Everything you need to know for the 2025 season-opening Australian Grand Prix at Albert Park in Melbourne.

title: Bell returned to the dirt. Now no one in NASCAR can stop him
content: After his team-imposed ban on dirt racing was lifted, Christopher Bell is back enjoying the hobby he loves, and his NASCAR form has never been better.

title: Family ties: Donovan McNabb Jr. receives offer from Michael Vick, Norfolk State
content: Donovan McNabb Jr. could have the opportunity to play for his dad's former Eagles teammate as Norfolk State became the latest school to make an offer to the 2027 wide receiver.

title: 'Bring the doughnuts': Cavs hilariously stuff Jaylon Tyson's vehicle for failing rookie task
content: The forward didn't deliver the team breakfast as asked, so his teammates replied with a rookie prank.

title: WWE 2K25 review: A solid entry that improves on its predecessor
content: The WWE 2K series has shown steady improvement since its soft relaunch with WWE 2K22 -- and WWE 2K25 is no exception.

title: 'What’s with these socks': Trump teases JD Vance in Oval Office; watch video
content: During the annual St. Patrick's Day celebration at the White House, President Trump praised Vice President JD Vance's shamrock-themed socks, creating a lighthearted moment that amused attendees. The conversation, which initially focused on inflation, shifted to Vance's festive accessories, garnering laughter and attention.

title: ‘No need for moon mission, Isro': Bengaluru residents on crater-riddled roads
content: Hundreds of frustrated residents in Bellandur protested against the poor condition of their crater-filled roads, urging the government for quick repairs. With no pavements and terrible road conditions, even short drives have become arduous, significantly impacting the daily lives and safety of the residents.

title: Sagar to Mahasagar: India upgrades Mauritius ties
content: India and Mauritius have upgraded their relationship to an Enhanced Strategic Partnership. Prime Minister Modi emphasized cooperation in defense, maritime security, trade, and development. India will support Mauritius with a new Parliament building and a rupee-denominated line of credit for water pipeline replacement. Both countries reaffirmed commitment to a secure and open Indian Ocean.

title: In her first post on X, Sunita Williams reveals what she misses the most while in space
content: Astronaut Sunita Williams has been stranded in space since June 6 due to a technical fault in the Boeing Starliner spacecraft. Attempts to bring her back with SpaceX's Crew 10 mission were unsuccessful. Williams, who misses her family, especially her pet, is facing mental and physical challenges while awaiting a safe return.

title: 'Pakistan is its worst enemy': Arthur backs Gillespie after ‘clown’ jab
content: Pakistan cricket is facing turmoil after an early exit from the Champions Trophy 2025. Mickey Arthur criticises the instability despite talented players and quality coaches like Jason Gillespie and Gary Kirsten. Internal conflicts and media agendas are blamed for undermining efforts. Babar Azam and Mohammad Rizwan have been dropped for the upcoming T20I series against New Zealand.

title: Stock market today: BSE Sensex opens in green; Nifty50 near 22,500
content: Stock market today: BSE Sensex and Nifty50, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in green on Thursday. While BSE Sensex was above 74,100, Nifty50 was near 22,500.

title: UP horror: Dressed as woman, man enters lover's house, sets her on fire
content: In Mathura, a 28-year-old man disguised as a woman entered his lover's home and set her on fire after she refused to elope with him. Rekha Kumari, 30, sustained 70% burn injuries. The accused, Umesh Singh, was a frequent visitor and had a previous relationship with Rekha. A case has been registered, and he is currently undergoing treatment.

title: 4 dead as speeding Mercedes wreaks havoc on Dehradun road, driver flees
content: A speeding Mercedes with a Chandigarh registration number killed four people and critically injured two others near Sai Baba Temple on Rajpur Road in Dehradun. The driver fled the scene. Authorities are working to identify the driver and have linked 11-12 vehicles to the case.

title: Viral video: Dhoni, Pant sing their hearts out to 'Tu Jaane Na'
content: A video of MS Dhoni and Rishabh Pant singing 'Tu Jaane Na' at Sakshi Pant's sangeet has gone viral. The ceremony, held in Dehradun, featured several cricket stars. Dhoni attended with his wife Sakshi, and Pant joined fresh from winning the Champions Trophy. More cricketers like Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli are expected at the wedding.

title: Rajan Shahi talks about managing Hina Khan's spa, waxing and other expenses
content: Yeh Rishta Kya Kehlata Hai has aired for over 15 years, starring Hina Khan and Karan Mehra as iconic characters Akshara and Naitik. Producer Rajan Shahi shared insights on preparing Hina for the role, involving extensive efforts and overcoming channel disapprovals. Despite past conflicts, Hina still acknowledges his support. The duo's storyline remains beloved.

title: Manipur talks stuck as Kukis insist on ‘separate hill state’
content: Following the return of a killed youth's body to his family in Manipur's Kangpokpi, authorities anticipate an end to protests and blockades in the district. However, tensions persist as the Kuki-Zo community demands a separate hill state, conflicting with the Constitutional framework. Efforts are ongoing to engage with both Meitei and Kuki-Zo communities for a resolution within Constitutional bounds.

title: Top stocks to buy today: Stock recommendations for March 13
content: Top stock market recommendations: Aakash K Hindocha of Nuvama Professional Clients Group recommends buying DLF, SRF, and Adani Ports. Nifty is poised for an upward journey towards 22800+, while Bank Nifty faces bearish pressures.

title: Holi and Holika Dahan 2025: Correct date, muhurat timings, rituals, significance, and all one needs to know
content: Holi 2025 celebrations will occur on March 13th and 14th, starting with Holika Dahan and followed by Rangwali Holi. Holika Dahan symbolizes the victory of good over evil, with rituals carried out around a bonfire. It's advised to use organic colors and play Holi consensually.

title: Tiny cut, but Ladli gets lion’s share of MP budget
content: Madhya Pradesh's 2025-26 budget sees a 15% increase over the previous year, reaching Rs 4,21,032 crore. Despite no new taxes, several key schemes face cuts, including Ladli Behna Yojana. Major cuts are also seen in allocations for primary and secondary schools, and PM Gram Sadak Yojana.

title: How Mohali Parking Row Led To Scientist's Death. His Mother Narrates Horror
content: Dr Abhishek Swarnkar, the 39-year-old scientist who died in Mohali after being assaulted over a parking row, was attacked after he warned the accused that he would file a complaint against him

title: How Ranya Rao Was Handed Gold At Dubai Airport To Be Smuggled To India
content: Actor Ranya Rao had prepared a meticulous plan to smuggle gold bars from Dubai and learnt how to conceal it in her clothing on YouTube, according to a document detailing the authorities' objections to her bail request.

title: Scientist Dies After Neighbour Assaults Him During Parking Row In Mohali
content: A 39-year-old scientist working at the Indian Institute of Science Education and Research (IISER), Mohali, has died after a parking dispute near his rented home in Sector 67 turned violent.

title: Chennai Doctor Dies By Suicide With Wife, 2 Sons; Cops Say He Had Huge Debt
content: A family of four - a doctor, his wife and two sons - were found dead at their home in Chennai's Anna Nagar this morning. The police suspect they died by suicide because of financial problems.

title: British Woman Allegedly Raped In Delhi Hotel By Man She Met on Instagram
content: A British citizen, who came to Delhi to meet a man she befriended on Instagram, was raped by him at a Mahipalpur hotel. The police have arrested the accused, Kailash, in a rape case and his friend, Wasim, has been charged with molesting the tourist

title: "Hostages Used As Human Shields": Pakistan Train Siege Ends After 30 Hours
content: The Jaffar Express, carrying 440 passengers, was hijacked by Baloch Liberation Army (BLA) members when it was going from Quetta to Peshawar.

title: The Balochistan Story: Jinnah Betrayal, Armed Rebellion, Bangladesh Impact
content: Balochistan, the largest and the most sparsely populated province of Pakistan, had always harboured dreams of being independent.

title: "Murder Conspiracy": Suchir Balaji's Mother Shares Pic From Day Of His Death
content: Suchir Balaji had turned a whistleblower against OpenAI shortly before his death. He had publicly raised ethical concerns about the AI giant's practices.

title: "Why Should I Speak Marathi?" Airtel Employee's Video Goes Viral, Sparks Row
content: BJP MLC Chitra Wagh called for promoting the use of local language in Maharashtra, a statement which comes after a video of a female employee of a prominent telecom company purportedly refusing to interact with a customer in Marathi went viral.

title: Opinion: Trump's Recession 'Cure' May Be Worse Than The Disease
content: A lot will depend on how trading partners respond to US threats, which, as of now, are more in posture and promise than measurable reality.

title: 'Person Of Interest' Named After Indian Goes Missing In Dominican Republic
content: Sudiksha Konanki, a University of Pittsburgh student from Virginia, was last seen on a beach in Punta Cana in the early hours of Thursday.

content: ankalaev enters the top 10 for the first time on a pair of ballots . one voter has him in the top four, while another puts him near the bottom of the rankings . both light heavyweights -- former champ and current one -- are in the ESPN men's pound-for-pound top 10 .

title: Was Thunder-Celtics an NBA Finals preview?
content: the Oklahoma City Thunder defeated the Boston Celtics 118-112 in a blockbuster matchup . the Western Conference-leading Thunder have improved their record against Eastern Conference teams to 22-1 . despite the team tying the NBA record for 3-point attempts, the Celtics faltered late .

title: Tracking NFL free agency: Live updates on every signing, trade, cut and rumor
content: free agency kicked off with the legal negotiation window on Monday . players can now officially sign with new teams as of 4 p.m. ET on monday . the new league year is the start of the new season .

title: "ICC Showed Mirror, Pakistan Don't Deserve To Be At CT Ceremony": Ex-Star
content: Kamran Akmal addressed the recent controversy surrounding the absence of a representative from host nation Pakistan during the prize distribution ceremony of the recently concluded Champions Trophy

title: Hands, Legs Broken In Car Crash, US Woman Found Stuck Inside 6 Days Later
content: An Indiana woman, missing for six days, was found alive on Tuesday inside her crashed car in Brooklyn. Brieonna Cassell was found by a passerby who was operating some equipment in the area.

title: NDTV Explains New Bill That Can Deny Foreigners Visas Over 'National Security'
content: Foreigners can be denied visas on national security grounds, their movements can be restricted, and they can be penalised for violating rules governing entry into, and exit from, India, according to a proposed law tabled by Home Minister Amit Shah.

title: NDTV Exclusive: Hunted Down, Massacred, Syria's Alawites Ask India For Help
content: Ali Koshmr, a 36-year-old man from Syria's Latakia, around 330 km from Damascus, woke up to the sounds of gunfire, tires screeching and dozens of armed men shouting, "Come out, you Alawite pigs, Nusayris!"

title: Inside Mirra Andreeva's meteoric rise in 2025
content: Mirra Andreeva became the youngest player since 2009 to win an 1000-level title . the 17-year-old won the trophy in Dubai and became the first player to win a title in 2025 . on tuesday, andreeva made good on her audacious prediction .

title: Tamil Nadu Replaces Rupee Symbol In State Budget Amid Row With Centre
content: the rupee symbol (Re) was replaced in promotional material for the 2025/26 state budget . posters for last year's budget included the Re symbol . the change was highlighted after chief minister MK Stalin shared the new logo on X .

title: Rohit "Might Exit International Cricket After...": Plans In Place - Report
content: 'Rohit Sharma way' says he is not going to retire from this format . he says his focus is on playing well and maintaining the right mindset . "there's no point in making such statements right now," he adds .
